speaker: SANDERS
text: You know, the older you get, the younger young gets -- 45 or younger -- is I think people are sensing that establishment politics and dependence on Wall Street and big money interest is really never going to address the crises that we face.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: SANDERS
text: And people understand, you can't take money from powerful special interests into your PAC and then really expect the American people to believe you're going to stand up to these powerful special interests.

speaker: SANDERS
text: So I am very proud of the fact that we have brought millions of new people into the political process...

speaker: BLITZER
text: Thank you, Senator.

speaker: SANDERS
text: ... many of whom previously had given up.

speaker: BLITZER
text: Thank you, Senator, very much.

speaker: BLITZER
text: The candidates, they will make their final pitches to New York voters right after this.

speaker: BLITZER
text: Welcome back to the CNN presidential debate.

speaker: BLITZER
text: It's time for the candidates' closing statements.

speaker: BLITZER
text: Each candidate will have two minutes.

speaker: BLITZER
text: Senator Sanders, you're first.

speaker: SANDERS
text: I grew up in Brooklyn, New York...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: SANDERS
text: ... the son of an immigrant who came to this country from Poland at the age of 17 without a nickel in his pocket, never made a whole lot of money, but was a very proud American, because this country gave him and my mom the opportunity to send their kids to college.

speaker: SANDERS
text: I believe that this country has enormous potential if we have the guts to take on the big money interests who dominate our economic and political life.

speaker: SANDERS
text: And I disagree with Secretary Clinton in the belief that you can get money from Wall Street, that you can get money for a super PAC from powerful special interests, and then at the end of the day do what has to be done for the working families of this country.

speaker: SANDERS
text: I just don't accept that.

speaker: SANDERS
text: What I believe is that this country, if we stand together and not let the Trumps of the world divide us up, can guarantee health care to all people as a right, can have paid family and medical leave, can make public colleges and universities tuition-free, can lead the world in transforming our energy system and combatting climate change, can break up the large financial institutions, can demand that the wealthiest people in this country start paying their fair share of taxes.

speaker: SANDERS
text: And we can do that when millions of people stand up, fight back, and create a government that works for all of us, not just the 1 percent.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: SANDERS
text: That is what the political revolution is about.

speaker: SANDERS
text: That is what this campaign is about.

speaker: SANDERS
text: And with your help, we're going to win here in New York.

speaker: SANDERS
text: Thank you.

speaker: SANDERS
text: Thank you.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: BLITZER
text: Secretary Clinton?

speaker: BLITZER
text: Secretary Clinton?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Thank you.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I am very grateful for the fact that the people of New York gave me the great honor of serving as your senator.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You took a chance on me in 2000, and then you re-elected me with one of the biggest margins we've had in our state in 2006.

speaker: CLINTON
text: During those years, we worked closely together.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I tried to have your back, and time and time again, you had mine.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We took on the challenges of 9/11 together.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We got the money to rebuild New York.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We came to the aid of our brave first responders, construction workers, and others who endangered their own health by helping to save lives and search for survivors.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: CLINTON
text: We worked to create jobs -- despite the disastrous policies of George W. Bush -- across New York.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And we stood up time and time again against all kinds of vested powerful interests.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I'm asking for your support again in the primary on Tuesday to continue that work together, to take what we did in New York and to take those New York values to the White House, and put them to work on behalf of all of our people, to knock down the barriers that stand in the way.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, of course we have economic barriers.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I've been fighting against those trying to even the odds most of my adult life.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But we also have racial barriers, gender barriers, homophobic barriers, disability barriers.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: CLINTON
text: We have a lot of barriers that stand in the way of people being treated as they should and having the chance to live up to their own God-given potential.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So I am humbly asking for your support on Tuesday.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I'll work my heart out for you again.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And together, we won't just make promises we can't keep.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We'll deliver results that will improve the lives of the people in New York and in America.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's what we'll do together.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Thank you, New York.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: BLITZER
text: Thank you, Secretary.

speaker: BLITZER
text: Thank you very much, Senator.

speaker: BLITZER
text: I want to thank the candidates for a really terrific debate.

speaker: BLITZER
text: Thanks also to Dana Bash and Errol Louis, as well as NY1, the Democratic National Committee, and everyone here at the Duggal Greenhouse at the Brooklyn Navy Yard.

speaker: BLITZER
text: Stay with CNN now for complete coverage of the New York primary next Tuesday.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you, thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Friends, delegates and fellow Americans: I humbly and gratefully accept your nomination for the presidency of the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: USA, USA, USA, USA, USA.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Who would have believed that when we started this journey because we are a team would have received almost 14 million votes the most in the history of the Republican party and that the Republican party would get 60 percent more votes than it received eight years ago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Who would have believed this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Who would have believed this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Democrats on the other hand received 20 percent fewer votes than they got four years ago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not so good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not so good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Together, we will lead our party back to the White House, and we will lead our country back to safety, prosperity, and peace.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will be a country of generosity and warmth.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we will also be a country of law and order.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our Convention occurs at a moment of crisis for our nation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The attacks on our police, and the terrorism of our cities, threaten our very way of life.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Any politician who does not grasp this danger is not fit to lead our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Americans watching this address tonight have seen the recent images of violence in our streets and the chaos in our communities.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Many have witnessed this violence personally, some have even been its victims.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have a message for all of you: the crime and violence that today afflicts our nation will soon, and I mean very soon, come to an end.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Beginning on January 20th of 2017, safety will be restored.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The most basic duty of government is to defend the lives of its own citizens.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Any government that fails to do so is a government unworthy to lead.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is finally time for a straightforward assessment of the state of our nation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will present the facts plainly and honestly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We cannot afford to be so politically correct anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So if you want to hear the corporate spin, the carefully-crafted lies, and the media myths the Democrats are holding their convention next week.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But here, at our convention, there will be no lies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will honor the American people with the truth, and nothing else.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are the facts: Decades of progress made in bringing down crime are now being reversed by this Administration's rollback of criminal enforcement.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Homicides last year increased by 17 percent in America's fifty largest cities.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That's the largest increase in 25 years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In our nation's capital, killings have risen by 50 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They are up nearly 60% in nearby Baltimore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In the President's hometown of Chicago, more than 2,000 people have been the victims of shootings this year alone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And more than 4,000 have been killed in the Chicago area since he took office.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The number of police officers killed in the line of duty has risen by almost 50% compared to this point last year.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nearly 180,000 illegal immigrants with criminal records, ordered deported from our country, are tonight roaming free to threaten peaceful citizens.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The number of new illegal immigrant families who have crossed the border so far this year already exceeds the entire total from 2015.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They are being released by the tens of thousands into our communities with no regard for the impact on public safety or resources.

speaker: TRUMP
text: One such border-crosser was released and made his way to Nebraska.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There, he ended the life of an innocent young girl named Sarah Root.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She was 21 years-old, and was killed the day after graduating from college with a 4.0 Grade Point Average.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Number one in her class.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Her killer was then released a second time, and he is now a fugitive from the law.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I've met Sarah's beautiful family.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But to this Administration, their amazing daughter was just one more American life that wasn't worth protecting.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No more.

speaker: TRUMP
text: One more child to sacrifice on the order and on the altar of open borders.

speaker: TRUMP
text: What about our economy?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Again, I will tell you the plain facts that have been edited out of your nightly news and your morning newspaper: Nearly 4 in 10 African-American children are living in poverty, while 58% of African-American youth are now not employed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: 2 million more Latinos are in poverty today than when President Obama took his oath of office less than eight years ago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Another 14 million people have left the workforce entirely.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Household incomes are down more than $4,000 since the year 2000.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That's sixteen years ago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our trade deficit has reached an all-time high think of this, think of this, our trade deficit is nearly $800 billion, think of that, 800 billion dollars, last year alone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're going to fix that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The budget is no better.

speaker: TRUMP
text: President Obama has almost doubled our national debt to more than $19 trillion, and growing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And yet, what do we have to show for it?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our roads and bridges are falling apart, our airports are Third World condition, and forty-three million Americans are on food stamps.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now let us consider the state of affairs abroad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not only have our citizens endured domestic disaster, but they've lived through one international humiliation after another.

speaker: TRUMP
text: One after another.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We all remember the images of our sailors being forced to their knees by their Iranian captors at gunpoint.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This was just prior to the signing of the Iran deal, which gave back to Iran $150 billion and gave us absolutely nothing  it will go down in history as one of the worst deals ever negotiated.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Another humiliation came when president Obama drew a red line in Syria  and the whole world knew it meant absolutely nothing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In Libya, our consulate  the symbol of American prestige around the globe  was brought down in flames.

speaker: TRUMP
text: America is far less safe  and the world is far less stable  than when Obama made the decision to put Hillary Clinton in charge of America's foreign policy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let's defeat her in November, okay?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am certain that it was a decision that President Obama truly regrets.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Her bad instincts and her bad judgment  something pointed out by Bernie Sanders  are what caused so many of the disasters unfolding today.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let's review the record.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In 2009, pre-Hillary, ISIS was not even on the map.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Libya was stable.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Egypt was peaceful.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Iraq was seeing and really a big big reduction in violence.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Iran was being choked by sanctions.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Syria was somewhat under control.

speaker: TRUMP
text: After four years of Hillary Clinton, what do we have?

speaker: TRUMP
text: ISIS has spread across the region, and the entire world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Libya is in ruins, and our Ambassador and his staff were left helpless to die at the hands of savage killers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Egypt was turned over to the radical Muslim brotherhood, forcing the military to retake control.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Iraq is in chaos.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Iran is on the path to nuclear weapons.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Syria is engulfed in a civil war and a refugee crisis, now threatens the West.

speaker: TRUMP
text: After fifteen years of wars in the Middle East, after trillions of dollars spent and thousands of lives lost, the situation is worse than it has ever been before.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is the legacy of Hillary Clinton: death, destruction, terrorism, and weakness.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But Hillary Clinton's legacy does not have to be America's legacy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The problems we face now  poverty and violence at home, war and destruction abroad  will last only as long as we continue relying on the same politicians who created them in the first place.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A change in leadership is required to produce a change in outcomes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Tonight, I will share with you my plan for action for America.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The most important difference between our plan and that of our opponents, is that our plan will put America First.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Americanism, not globalism, will be our credo.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As long as we are led by politicians who will not put America First, then we can be assured that other nations will not treat America with respect.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The respect that we deserve.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The American People will come first once again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My plan will begin with safety at home  which means safe neighborhoods, secure borders, and protection from terrorism.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There can be no prosperity without law and order.

speaker: TRUMP
text: On the economy, I will outline reforms to add millions of new jobs and trillions in new wealth that can be used to rebuild America.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A number of these reforms that I will outline tonight will be opposed by some of our nation's most powerful special interests.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That's because these interests have rigged our political and economic system for their exclusive benefit.

text: Believe me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's for their benefit.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Big business, elite media and major donors are lining up behind the campaign of my opponent because they know she will keep our rigged system in place.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They are throwing money at her because they have total control over everything single thing she does.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She is their puppet, and they pull the strings.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That is why Hillary Clinton's message is that things will never change.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Never ever.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My message is that things have to change  and they have to change right now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Every day I wake up determined to deliver a better life for the people all across this nation that have been neglected, ignored, and abandoned.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have visited the laid-off factory workers, and the communities crushed by our horrible and unfair trade deals.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are the forgotten men and women of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they are forgotten.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But they're not going to be forgotten long.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are people who work hard but no longer have a voice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am your voice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have embraced crying mothers who have lost their children because our politicians put their personal agendas before the national good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have no patience for injustice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: How great are our police!

speaker: TRUMP
text: And how great is Cleveland?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have no patience for injustice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No tolerance for government incompetence of which there is so much, no sympathy for leaders who fail their citizens.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When innocent people suffer, because our political system lacks the will, or the courage, or the basic decency to enforce our laws  or still worse, has sold out to some corporate lobbyist for cash  I am not able to look the other way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I won't look the other way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And when a Secretary of State illegally stores her emails on a private server, deletes 33,000 of them so the authorities can't see her crime, puts our country at risk, lies about it in every different form and faces no consequence  I know that corruption has reached a level like never ever before in our country.

text: When the FBI Director says that the Secretary of State was "extremely careless" and "negligent," in handling our classified secrets, I also know that these terms are minor compared to what she actually did.

text: They were just used to save her from facing justice for her terrible, terrible crimes.

text: In fact, her single greatest accomplishment may be committing such egregious crime and getting away with it  especially when others who have done far less, have paid so dearly.

text: When that same Secretary of State rakes in millions and millions of dollars trading access and favors to special interests and foreign powers I know the time for action has come.

text: I have joined the political arena so that the powerful can no longer beat up on people who cannot defend themselves.

text: Nobody knows the system better than me.

text: Which is why I alone can fix it.

text: I have seen firsthand how the system is rigged against our citizens, just like it was rigged against Bernie Sanders  he never had a chance.

text: But his supporters will join our movement, because we will fix his biggest single issue: trade deals that strip our country of its jobs and strip us of our wealth as a country.

text: Millions of Democrats will join our movement, because we are going to fix the system so it works fairly and justly for all Americans.

text: Which is amazing.

text: He's a man of character and accomplishment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He's the man for the job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The first task for our new Administration will be to liberate our citizens from the crime and terrorism and lawlessness that threatens our community.

text: America was shocked to its core when our police officers in Dallas were so brutally executed.

text: I have a message to every last person threatening the peace on our streets and the safety of our police: when I take the oath of office next year, I will restore law and order to our country.

text: Believe me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Believe me.

text: I will work with, and appoint, the best and brightest prosecutors and law enforcement officials to get the job properly done.

text: The irresponsible rhetoric of our President, who has used the pulpit of the presidency to divide us by race and color, has made America a more dangerous environment that frankly that I have ever seen of anybody in this room has ever watched or seen.

text: To make life safe for all of our citizens, we must also address the growing threats from outside the country.

text: The damage and devastation that can be inflicted by Islamic radicals has been proven over and over  at the World Trade Center, at an office party in San Bernardino, at the Boston Marathon, at a military recruiting center in Chattanooga, Tennessee.

text: And many many other locations.

text: Only weeks ago, in Orlando, Florida, 49 wonderful Americans were savagely murdered by an Islamic terrorist.

text: Thank you.

text: To protect us from terrorism, we need to focus on three things.

text: We must abandon the failed policy of nation building and regime change that Hillary Clinton pushed in Iraq, in Libya, in Egypt and in Syria.

text: Instead, we must work with all of our allies who share our goal of destroying ISIS and stamping out Islamic terrorism and doing it now, doing it quickly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're going to win.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're going to win fast.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This includes working with our greatest ally in the region, the State of Israel.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Recently, I have said NATO is obsolete because it did not properly cover terror.

text: And also that many of the member countries were not paying their fair share.

text: As usual, the United States has been picking up the costs.

text: Shortly thereafter, it was announced that NATO will be setting up a new program in order to combat terrorism.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A true step in the right direction.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Lastly, and very importantly, we must immediately suspend immigration from any nation that has been compromised by terrorism until such time as proven vetting mechanisms have been put in place.

text: We don't want them in our country.

text: My opponent has called for a radical 550% increase in Syrian, think of this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Think of this, this is not believable but this is what's happening.

text: A 550 percent increase in Syrian refugees on top of existing massive refugee flows coming into our country already under the leadership of President Obama.

text: She proposes this despite the fact that there's no way to screen these refugees in order to find out who they are or where they come from.

text: I only want to admit individuals into our country who will support our values and love our people.

text: Anyone who endorses violence, hatred or oppression is not welcome in our country and never ever will be.

text: Decades of record immigration have produced lower wages and higher unemployment for our citizens, especially for African-American and Latino workers.

text: We are going to have an immigration system that works, but one that works for the American people.

text: On Monday, we heard from three parents whose children were killed by illegal immigrants: Mary Ann Mendoza, Sabine Durden, and my friend Jamiel Shaw.

text: Of all my travels in this country, nothing has affected me more, nothing even close I have to tell you, than the time I have spent with the mothers and fathers who have lost their children to violence spilling across our borders which we can solve.

text: We have to solve it.

text: These families have no special interests to represent them.

text: There are no demonstrators to protect them and certainly none to protest on their behalf.

text: Where was the Sanctuary for the children of Mary Ann, and Sabine and Jamiel?

text: These wounded American families have been alone.

text: But they are not alone any longer.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Tonight, this candidate and the whole nation stand in their corner to support them, to send them our love, and to pledge in their honor that we will save countless more families from suffering and the same awful fate.

text: We are going to build a great border wall to stop illegal immigration, to stop the gangs and the violence, and to stop the drugs from pouring into our communities.

text: I have been honored to receive the endorsement of America's Border Patrol Agents.

text: And will work directly with them to protect the integrity of our lawful, lawful, lawful immigration system.

text: By ending catch-and-release on the border, we will end the cycle of human smuggling and violence.

text: We will stop it, it won't be happening very much anymore.

text: Believe me.

speaker: TRUMP

text: By enforcing the rules for millions who overstay their visas, our laws will finally receive the respect that they deserve.

text: Tonight, I want every American whose demands for immigration security have been denied  and every politician who has denied them  to listen very, very closely to the words I am about to say.

text: On January 20th of 2017, the day I take the oath of office, Americans will finally wake up in a country where the laws of the United States are enforced.

text: But my greatest compassion will be for our own struggling citizens.

text: USA.

speaker: TRUMP
text: USA.

speaker: TRUMP
text: USA.

text: My plan is the exact opposite of the radical and dangerous immigration policy of Hillary Clinton.

text: Americans want relief from uncontrolled immigration.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Which is what we have now.

text: Communities want relief.

text: Yet Hillary Clinton is proposing mass amnesty, mass immigration, and mass lawlessness.

text: Her plan will overwhelm your schools and hospitals, further reduce your jobs and wages, and make it harder for recent immigrants to escape the tremendous cycle poverty that they're going through right now and make it almost impossible for them to join the middle class.

text: I have a different vision for our workers.

text: It begins with a new, fair trade policy that protects our jobs and stands up to countries that cheat.

text: Of which there are many.

text: It's been a signature message of my campaign from day one, and it will be a signature feature of my presidency from the moment I take the oath of office.

text: I have made billions of dollars in business making deals  now I'm going to make our country rich again.

text: Using the greatest business people in the world, which our country has, I am going to turn our bad trade agreements into great trade agreements.

text: America has lost nearly-one third of its manufacturing jobs since 1997, following the enactment of disastrous trade deals supported by Bill and Hillary Clinton.

text: Or frankly, any other country.

text: I am going to bring our jobs back to Ohio and Pennsylvania, and New York, and Michigan, and all of America  and I am not going to let companies move to other countries, firing their employees along the way, without consequence.

text: She supported NAFTA, and she supported China's entrance into the World Trade Organization  another one of her husband's colossal mistakes and disasters.

text: We will never sign bad trade deals.

text: America First again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: America First.

text: No longer will we enter into these massive transactions, with many countries, that are thousands of pages long  and which no one from our country even reads or understands.

text: This includes stopping China's outrageous theft of intellectual property, along with their illegal product dumping, and their devastating currency manipulation.

text: They are the greatest that ever came about.

speaker: TRUMP

text: Our horrible trade agreements with China and many others will be totally renegotiated.

text: That includes renegotiating NAFTA to get a much better deal for America  and we'll walk away if we don't get that kind of a deal.

text: Our country is going to start building and making things again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Next comes the reform of our tax laws, regulations and energy rules.

text: While Hillary Clinton plans a massive, and I mean massive, tax increase, I have proposed the largest tax reduction of any candidate who has run for the president this year  Democrat or Republican.

speaker: TRUMP
text: While Hillary Clinton plans a massive, and I mean massive, tax increase, I have proposed the largest tax reduction of any candidate who has run for the president this year  Democrat or Republican.

text: Middle-income Americans and businesses will experience profound relief, and taxes will be greatly simplified for everyone.

text: I mean everyone.

text: America is one of the highest-taxed nations in the world.

text: Believe me, it'll happen and it'll happen fast.

text: Excessive regulation is costing our country as much as $2 trillion a year, and we will end it very, very quickly.

text: We are going to lift the restrictions on the production of American energy.

text: This will produce more than $20 trillion in job-creating economic activity over the next four decades.

text: Our steelworkers and our miners are going back to work again.

text: This new wealth will improve the quality of life for all Americans  We will build the roads, highways, bridges, tunnels, airports, and the railways of tomorrow.

text: This, in turn, will create millions of more jobs.

text: We will rescue kids from failing schools by helping their parents send them to a safe school of their choice.

text: My opponent would rather protect bureaucrats than serve American children.

text: And that's what she's doing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that's what's she's done.

text: We will repeal and replace disastrous Obamacare.

text: We will completely rebuild our depleted military, and the countries that we protect, at a massive cost to us, will be asked to pay their fair share.

text: We are going to ask every Department Head in government to provide a list of wasteful spending projects that we can eliminate in my first 100 days.

text: The politicians have talked about this for years, but I'm going to do it.

text: Very important.

text: This will be one of the most important issues decided by this election.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My opponent wants to essentially abolish the 2nd amendment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I, on the other hand, received the early and strong endorsement of the National Rifle Association and will protect the right of all Americans to keep their families safe.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At this moment, I would like to thank the evangelical and religious community because I'll tell you what.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because the support they've given me, and I'm not sure I totally deserve it, has been so amazing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And has had such a big reason for me being here tonight.

speaker: TRUMP
text: True.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So true.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They have so much to contribute to our politics, yet our laws prevent you from speaking your minds from your own pulpits.

speaker: TRUMP
text: An amendment, pushed by Lyndon Johnson, many years ago, threatens religious institutions with a loss of their tax-exempt status if they openly advocate their political views.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Their voice has been taken away.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am going to work very hard to repeal that language and to protect free speech for all Americans.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We can accomplish these great things, and so much more  all we need to do is start believing in ourselves and in our country again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Start believing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is time to show the whole world that America Is Back  bigger, and better and stronger than ever before.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In this journey, I'm so lucky to have at my side my wife Melania and my wonderful children, Don, Ivanka, Eric, Tiffany, and Barron: you will always be my greatest source of pride and joy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And by the way, Melania and Ivanka, did they do a job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My Dad, Fred Trump, was the smartest and hardest working man I ever knew.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I wonder sometimes what he'd say if he were here to see this, and to see me, tonight.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's because of him that I learned, from my youngest age, to respect the dignity of work and the dignity of working people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He was a guy most comfortable in the company of bricklayers, and carpenters, and electricians and I have a lot of that in me also.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I love those people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Then there's my mother, Mary.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She was strong, but also warm and fair-minded.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She was a truly great mother.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She was also one of the most honest and charitable people I have ever known, and a great great judge of character.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She could pick 'em out from anywhere.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To my sisters Mary Anne and Elizabeth, my brother Robert and my late brother Fred, I will always give you my love you are most special to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have had a truly great life in business.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But now, my sole and exclusive mission is to go to work for our country  to go to work for you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's time to deliver a victory for the American people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don't win anymore, but we are going to start winning again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But to do that, we must break free from the petty politics of the past.

speaker: TRUMP
text: America is a nation of believers, dreamers, and strivers that is being led by a group of censors, critics, and cynics.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Remember: all of the people telling you you can't have the country you want, are the same people telling you that wouldn't stand, I mean they said Trump doesn't have a chance of being here tonight.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not a chance.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The same people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Oh we love defeating those people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Don't we?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Don't we?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Love it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Love it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Love it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No longer can we rely on those same people in the media media, and politics, who will say anything to keep a rigged system in place.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Instead, we must choose to Believe In America.

speaker: TRUMP
text: History is watching us now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don't have much time, but history is watching.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's waiting to see if we will rise to the occasion, and if we will show the whole world that America is still free and independent and strong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am asking for your support tonight so I can be your champion in the White House.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I will be your champion.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My opponent asks her supporters to recite a three-word loyalty pledge.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It reads: "I'm With Her".

speaker: TRUMP
text: I choose to recite a different pledge.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My pledge reads: "I'M WITH YOU  THE AMERICAN PEOPLE."

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am your voice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So to every parent who dreams for their child, and every child who dreams for their future, I say these words to you tonight: I am With You, and I will fight for you, and I will win for you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To all Americans tonight, in all of our cities and in all of our towns, I make this promise: We Will Make America Strong Again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We Will Make America Proud Again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We Will Make America Safe Again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And We Will Make America Great Again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: God bless you, and goodnight.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I love you.

speaker: HOLT
text: Good evening from Hofstra University in Hempstead, New York.

speaker: HOLT
text: I'm Lester Holt, anchor of "NBC Nightly News."

speaker: HOLT
text: I want to welcome you to the first presidential debate.

speaker: HOLT
text: The participants tonight are Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton.

speaker: HOLT
text: This debate is sponsored by the Commission on Presidential Debates, a nonpartisan, nonprofit organization.

speaker: HOLT
text: The commission drafted tonight's format, and the rules have been agreed to by the campaigns.

speaker: HOLT
text: The 90-minute debate is divided into six segments, each 15 minutes long.

speaker: HOLT
text: We'll explore three topic areas tonight: Achieving prosperity; America's direction; and securing America.

speaker: HOLT
text: At the start of each segment, I will ask the same lead-off question to both candidates, and they will each have up to two minutes to respond.

speaker: HOLT
text: From that point until the end of the segment, we'll have an open discussion.

speaker: HOLT
text: The questions are mine and have not been shared with the commission or the campaigns.

speaker: HOLT
text: The audience here in the room has agreed to remain silent so that we can focus on what the candidates are saying.

speaker: HOLT
text: I will invite you to applaud, however, at this moment, as we welcome the candidates: Democratic nominee for president of the United States, Hillary Clinton, and Republican nominee for president of the United States, Donald J. Trump.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: CLINTON
text: How are you, Donald?

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: HOLT
text: Good luck to you.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: HOLT
text: Well, I don't expect us to cover all the issues of this campaign tonight, but I remind everyone, there are two more presidential debates scheduled.

speaker: HOLT
text: We are going to focus on many of the issues that voters tell us are most important, and we're going to press for specifics.

speaker: HOLT
text: I am honored to have this role, but this evening belongs to the candidates and, just as important, to the American people.

speaker: HOLT
text: Candidates, we look forward to hearing you articulate your policies and your positions, as well as your visions and your values.

speaker: HOLT
text: So, let's begin.

speaker: HOLT
text: We're calling this opening segment "Achieving Prosperity."

speaker: HOLT
text: And central to that is jobs.

speaker: HOLT
text: There are two economic realities in America today.

speaker: HOLT
text: There's been a record six straight years of job growth, and new census numbers show incomes have increased at a record rate after years of stagnation.

speaker: HOLT
text: However, income inequality remains significant, and nearly half of Americans are living paycheck to paycheck.

speaker: HOLT
text: Beginning with you, Secretary Clinton, why are you a better choice than your opponent to create the kinds of jobs that will put more money into the pockets of American works?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, thank you, Lester, and thanks to Hofstra for hosting us.

speaker: CLINTON
text: The central question in this election is really what kind of country we want to be and what kind of future we'll build together.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Today is my granddaughter's second birthday, so I think about this a lot.

speaker: CLINTON
text: First, we have to build an economy that works for everyone, not just those at the top.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That means we need new jobs, good jobs, with rising incomes.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I want us to invest in you.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I want us to invest in your future.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That means jobs in infrastructure, in advanced manufacturing, innovation and technology, clean, renewable energy, and small business, because most of the new jobs will come from small business.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We also have to make the economy fairer.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That starts with raising the national minimum wage and also guarantee, finally, equal pay for women's work.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I also want to see more companies do profit-sharing.

speaker: CLINTON
text: If you help create the profits, you should be able to share in them, not just the executives at the top.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I want us to do more to support people who are struggling to balance family and work.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I've heard from so many of you about the difficult choices you face and the stresses that you're under.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So let's have paid family leave, earned sick days.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Let's be sure we have affordable child care and debt-free college.

speaker: CLINTON
text: How are we going to do it?

speaker: CLINTON
text: We're going to do it by having the wealthy pay their fair share and close the corporate loopholes.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Finally, we tonight are on the stage together, Donald Trump and I. Donald, it's good to be with you.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We're going to have a debate where we are talking about the important issues facing our country.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You have to judge us, who can shoulder the immense, awesome responsibilities of the presidency, who can put into action the plans that will make your life better.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I hope that I will be able to earn your vote on November 8th.

speaker: HOLT
text: Secretary Clinton, thank you.

speaker: HOLT
text: Mr. Trump, the same question to you.

speaker: HOLT
text: It's about putting money -- more money into the pockets of American workers.

speaker: HOLT
text: You have up to two minutes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you, Lester.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our jobs are fleeing the country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They're going to Mexico.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They're going to many other countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You look at what China is doing to our country in terms of making our product.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They're devaluing their currency, and there's nobody in our government to fight them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we have a very good fight.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we have a winning fight.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because they're using our country as a piggy bank to rebuild China, and many other countries are doing the same thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we're losing our good jobs, so many of them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When you look at what's happening in Mexico, a friend of mine who builds plants said it's the eighth wonder of the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They're building some of the biggest plants anywhere in the world, some of the most sophisticated, some of the best plants.

speaker: TRUMP
text: With the United States, as he said, not so much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So Ford is leaving.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You see that, their small car division leaving.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thousands of jobs leaving Michigan, leaving Ohio.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They're all leaving.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we can't allow it to happen anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As far as child care is concerned and so many other things, I think Hillary and I agree on that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We probably disagree a little bit as to numbers and amounts and what we're going to do, but perhaps we'll be talking about that later.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we have to stop our jobs from being stolen from us.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to stop our companies from leaving the United States and, with it, firing all of their people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All you have to do is take a look at Carrier air conditioning in Indianapolis.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They left -- fired 1,400 people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They're going to Mexico.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So many hundreds and hundreds of companies are doing this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We cannot let it happen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Under my plan, I'll be reducing taxes tremendously, from 35 percent to 15 percent for companies, small and big businesses.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That's going to be a job creator like we haven't seen since Ronald Reagan.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's going to be a beautiful thing to watch.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Companies will come.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They will build.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They will expand.

speaker: TRUMP
text: New companies will start.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I look very, very much forward to doing it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to renegotiate our trade deals, and we have to stop these countries from stealing our companies and our jobs.

speaker: HOLT
text: Secretary Clinton, would you like to respond?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, I think that trade is an important issue.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Of course, we are 5 percent of the world's population; we have to trade with the other 95 percent.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And we need to have smart, fair trade deals.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We also, though, need to have a tax system that rewards work and not just financial transactions.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And the kind of plan that Donald has put forth would be trickle-down economics all over again.

speaker: CLINTON
text: In fact, it would be the most extreme version, the biggest tax cuts for the top percent of the people in this country than we've ever had.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I call it trumped-up trickle-down, because that's exactly what it would be.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That is not how we grow the economy.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We just have a different view about what's best for growing the economy, how we make investments that will actually produce jobs and rising incomes.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I think we come at it from somewhat different perspectives.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I understand that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, Donald was very fortunate in his life, and that's all to his benefit.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He started his business with $14 million, borrowed from his father, and he really believes that the more you help wealthy people, the better off we'll be and that everything will work out from there.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I don't buy that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I have a different experience.

speaker: CLINTON
text: My father was a small-businessman.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He worked really hard.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He printed drapery fabrics on long tables, where he pulled out those fabrics and he went down with a silkscreen and dumped the paint in and took the squeegee and kept going.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And so what I believe is the more we can do for the middle class, the more we can invest in you, your education, your skills, your future, the better we will be off and the better we'll grow.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's the kind of economy I want us to see again.

speaker: HOLT
text: Let me follow up with Mr. Trump, if you can.

speaker: HOLT
text: You've talked about creating 25 million jobs, and you've promised to bring back millions of jobs for Americans.

speaker: HOLT
text: How are you going to bring back the industries that have left this country for cheaper labor overseas?

speaker: HOLT
text: How, specifically, are you going to tell American manufacturers that you have to come back?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, for one thing -- and before we start on that -- my father gave me a very small loan in 1975, and I built it into a company that's worth many, many billions of dollars, with some of the greatest assets in the world, and I say that only because that's the kind of thinking that our country needs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our country's in deep trouble.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don't know what we're doing when it comes to devaluations and all of these countries all over the world, especially China.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They're the best, the best ever at it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: What they're doing to us is a very, very sad thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we have to do that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to renegotiate our trade deals.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And, Lester, they're taking our jobs, they're giving incentives, they're doing things that, frankly, we don't do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let me give you the example of Mexico.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They have a VAT tax.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're on a different system.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When we sell into Mexico, there's a tax.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When they sell in -- automatic, 16 percent, approximately.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When they sell into us, there's no tax.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's a defective agreement.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's been defective for a long time, many years, but the politicians haven't done anything about it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, in all fairness to Secretary Clinton -- yes, is that OK?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I want you to be very happy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's very important to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But in all fairness to Secretary Clinton, when she started talking about this, it was really very recently.

speaker: TRUMP
text: She's been doing this for 30 years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And why hasn't she made the agreements better?

speaker: TRUMP
text: The NAFTA agreement is defective.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Just because of the tax and many other reasons, but just because of the fact...

speaker: HOLT
text: Let me interrupt just a moment, but...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Secretary Clinton and others, politicians, should have been doing this for years, not right now, because of the fact that we've created a movement.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They should have been doing this for years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: What's happened to our jobs and our country and our economy generally is -- look, we owe $20 trillion.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We cannot do it any longer, Lester.

speaker: HOLT
text: Back to the question, though.

speaker: HOLT
text: How do you bring back -- specifically bring back jobs, American manufacturers?

speaker: HOLT
text: How do you make them bring the jobs back?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, the first thing you do is don't let the jobs leave.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The companies are leaving.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I could name, I mean, there are thousands of them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They're leaving, and they're leaving in bigger numbers than ever.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And what you do is you say, fine, you want to go to Mexico or some other country, good luck.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We wish you a lot of luck.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But if you think you're going to make your air conditioners or your cars or your cookies or whatever you make and bring them into our country without a tax, you're wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And once you say you're going to have to tax them coming in, and our politicians never do this, because they have special interests and the special interests want those companies to leave, because in many cases, they own the companies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So what I'm saying is, we can stop them from leaving.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to stop them from leaving.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that's a big, big factor.

speaker: HOLT
text: Let me let Secretary Clinton get in here.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, let's stop for a second and remember where we were eight years ago.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We had the worst financial crisis, the Great Recession, the worst since the 1930s.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That was in large part because of tax policies that slashed taxes on the wealthy, failed to invest in the middle class, took their eyes off of Wall Street, and created a perfect storm.

speaker: CLINTON
text: In fact, Donald was one of the people who rooted for the housing crisis.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He said, back in 2006, "Gee, I hope it does collapse, because then I can go in and buy some and make some money."

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, it did collapse.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That's called business, by the way.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Nine million people -- nine million people lost their jobs.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Five million people lost their homes.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And $13 trillion in family wealth was wiped out.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Now, we have come back from that abyss.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And it has not been easy.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So we're now on the precipice of having a potentially much better economy, but the last thing we need to do is to go back to the policies that failed us in the first place.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Independent experts have looked at what I've proposed and looked at what Donald's proposed, and basically they've said this, that if his tax plan, which would blow up the debt by over $5 trillion and would in some instances disadvantage middle-class families compared to the wealthy, were to go into effect, we would lose 3.5 million jobs and maybe have another recession.

speaker: CLINTON
text: They've looked at my plans and they've said, OK, if we can do this, and I intend to get it done, we will have 10 million more new jobs, because we will be making investments where we can grow the economy.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Take clean energy.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Some country is going to be the clean- energy superpower of the 21st century.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Donald thinks that climate change is a hoax perpetrated by the Chinese.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I think it's real.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I did not.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I did not.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I do not say that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I think science is real.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I do not say that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I think it's important that we grip this and deal with it, both at home and abroad.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And here's what we can do.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We can deploy a half a billion more solar panels.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We can have enough clean energy to power every home.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We can build a new modern electric grid.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's a lot of jobs; that's a lot of new economic activity.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So I've tried to be very specific about what we can and should do, and I am determined that we're going to get the economy really moving again, building on the progress we've made over the last eight years, but never going back to what got us in trouble in the first place.

speaker: HOLT
text: Mr. Trump?

speaker: TRUMP
text: She talks about solar panels.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We invested in a solar company, our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That was a disaster.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They lost plenty of money on that one.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, look, I'm a great believer in all forms of energy, but we're putting a lot of people out of work.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our energy policies are a disaster.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our country is losing so much in terms of energy, in terms of paying off our debt.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You can't do what you're looking to do with $20 trillion in debt.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Obama administration, from the time they've come in, is over 230 years' worth of debt, and he's topped it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He's doubled it in a course of almost eight years, seven-and-a-half years, to be semi- exact.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I will tell you this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to do a much better job at keeping our jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we have to do a much better job at giving companies incentives to build new companies or to expand, because they're not doing it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And all you have to do is look at Michigan and look at Ohio and look at all of these places where so many of their jobs and their companies are just leaving, they're gone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And, Hillary, I'd just ask you this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You've been doing this for 30 years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Why are you just thinking about these solutions right now?

speaker: TRUMP
text: For 30 years, you've been doing it, and now you're just starting to think of solutions.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, actually...

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will bring -- excuse me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will bring back jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You can't bring back jobs.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, actually, I have thought about this quite a bit.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yeah, for 30 years.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I have -- well, not quite that long.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I think my husband did a pretty good job in the 1990s.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I think a lot about what worked and how we can make it work again...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, he approved NAFTA...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: CLINTON
text: million new jobs, a balanced budget...

speaker: TRUMP
text: He approved NAFTA, which is the single worst trade deal ever approved in this country.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Incomes went up for everybody.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Manufacturing jobs went up also in the 1990s, if we're actually going to look at the facts.

speaker: CLINTON
text: When I was in the Senate, I had a number of trade deals that came before me, and I held them all to the same test.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Will they create jobs in America?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Will they raise incomes in America?

speaker: CLINTON
text: And are they good for our national security?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Some of them I voted for.

speaker: CLINTON
text: The biggest one, a multinational one known as CAFTA, I voted against.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And because I hold the same standards as I look at all of these trade deals.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But let's not assume that trade is the only challenge we have in the economy.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I think it is a part of it, and I've said what I'm going to do.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I'm going to have a special prosecutor.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We're going to enforce the trade deals we have, and we're going to hold people accountable.

speaker: CLINTON
text: When I was secretary of state, we actually increased American exports globally 30 percent.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We increased them to China 50 percent.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So I know how to really work to get new jobs and to get exports that helped to create more new jobs.

speaker: HOLT
text: Very quickly...

text: And when these people are going to put billions and billions of dollars into companies, and when they're going to bring $2.5 trillion back from overseas, where they can't bring the money back, because politicians like Secretary Clinton won't allow them to bring the money back, because the taxes are so onerous, and the bureaucratic red tape, so what -- is so bad.

text: You can go and see nearly, I think, 39, 40 years of our tax returns, but everyone has done it.

text: First, maybe he's not as rich as he says he is.

text: Second, maybe he's not as charitable as he claims to be.

text: So if he's paid zero, that means zero for troops, zero for vets, zero for schools or health.

text: They don't give you all the details that tax returns would.

text: And it just seems to me that this is something that the American people deserve to see.

text: And we'll guess.

text: That I can tell you.

text: The buildings that were in question, they said in the same report, which was -- actually, it wasn't even a bad story, to be honest with you, but the buildings are worth $3.9 billion.

text: And the $650 isn't even on that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it's not $650.

text: It's much less than that.

text: But I could give you a list of banks, I would -- if that would help you, I would give you a list of banks.

text: These are very fine institutions, very fine banks.

text: I could do that very quickly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am very underleveraged.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have a great company.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have a tremendous income.

text: And the reason I say that is not in a braggadocios way.

text: It's because it's about time that this country had somebody running it that has an idea about money.

text: When we have $20 trillion in debt, and our country's a mess, you know, it's one thing to have $20 trillion in debt and our roads are good and our bridges are good and everything's in great shape, our airports.

text: You land at LaGuardia, you land at Kennedy, you land at LAX, you land at Newark, and you come in from Dubai and Qatar and you see these incredible -- you come in from China, you see these incredible airports, and you land -- we've become a third world country.

text: So the worst of all things has happened.

text: We owe $20 trillion, and we're a mess.

text: We haven't even started.

text: And we've spent $6 trillion in the Middle East, according to a report that I just saw.

text: Whether it's 6 or 5, but it looks like it's 6, $6 trillion in the Middle East, we could have rebuilt our country twice.

text: And it's really a shame.

text: And it's politicians like Secretary Clinton that have caused this problem.

text: Our country has tremendous problems.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're a debtor nation.

text: We're a serious debtor nation.

text: And we have a country that needs new roads, new tunnels, new bridges, new airports, new schools, new hospitals.

text: And we don't have the money, because it's been squandered on so many of your ideas.

text: And the other thing I think is important...

speaker: TRUMP
text: It would be squandered, too, believe me.

speaker: CLINTON
text: is if your -- if your main claim to be president of the United States is your business, then I think we should talk about that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, your campaign manager said that you built a lot of businesses on the backs of little guys.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And, indeed, I have met a lot of the people who were stiffed by you and your businesses, Donald.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I've met dishwashers, painters, architects, glass installers, marble installers, drapery installers, like my dad was, who you refused to pay when they finished the work that you asked them to do.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We have an architect in the audience who designed one of your clubhouses at one of your golf courses.

speaker: CLINTON
text: It's a beautiful facility.

speaker: CLINTON
text: It immediately was put to use.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And you wouldn't pay what the man needed to be paid, what he was charging you to do...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Maybe he didn't do a good job and I was unsatisfied with his work...

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, to...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Which our country should do, too.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Do the thousands of people that you have stiffed over the course of your business not deserve some kind of apology from someone who has taken their labor, taken the goods that they produced, and then refused to pay them?

speaker: CLINTON
text: I can only say that I'm certainly relieved that my late father never did business with you.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He provided a good middle-class life for us, but the people he worked for, he expected the bargain to be kept on both sides.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And when we talk about your business, you've taken business bankruptcy six times.

speaker: CLINTON
text: There are a lot of great businesspeople that have never taken bankruptcy once.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You call yourself the King of Debt.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You talk about leverage.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You even at one time suggested that you would try to negotiate down the national debt of the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wrong.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, sometimes there's not a direct transfer of skills from business to government, but sometimes what happened in business would be really bad for government.

speaker: HOLT
text: Let's let Mr. Trump...

speaker: CLINTON
text: And we need to be very clear about that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So, yeah, I think -- I do think it's time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look, it's all words, it's all sound bites.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I built an unbelievable company.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Some of the greatest assets anywhere in the world, real estate assets anywhere in the world, beyond the United States, in Europe, lots of different places.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's an unbelievable company.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But on occasion, four times, we used certain laws that are there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And when Secretary Clinton talks about people that didn't get paid, first of all, they did get paid a lot, but taken advantage of the laws of the nation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, if you want to change the laws, you've been there a long time, change the laws.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I take advantage of the laws of the nation because I'm running a company.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My obligation right now is to do well for myself, my family, my employees, for my companies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that's what I do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But what she doesn't say is that tens of thousands of people that are unbelievably happy and that love me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'll give you an example.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're just opening up on Pennsylvania Avenue right next to the White House, so if I don't get there one way, I'm going to get to Pennsylvania Avenue another.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we're opening the Old Post Office.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Under budget, ahead of schedule, saved tremendous money.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'm a year ahead of schedule.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that's what this country should be doing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We build roads and they cost two and three and four times what they're supposed to cost.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We buy products for our military and they come in at costs that are so far above what they were supposed to be, because we don't have people that know what they're doing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When we look at the budget, the budget is bad to a large extent because we have people that have no idea as to what to do and how to buy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Trump International is way under budget and way ahead of schedule.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we should be able to do that for our country.

speaker: HOLT
text: Well, we're well behind schedule, so I want to move to our next segment.

speaker: HOLT
text: We move into our next segment talking about America's direction.

speaker: HOLT
text: And let's start by talking about race.

speaker: HOLT
text: The share of Americans who say race relations are bad in this country is the highest it's been in decades, much of it amplified by shootings of African-Americans by police, as we've seen recently in Charlotte and Tulsa.

speaker: HOLT
text: Race has been a big issue in this campaign, and one of you is going to have to bridge a very wide and bitter gap.

speaker: HOLT
text: So how do you heal the divide?

speaker: HOLT
text: Secretary Clinton, you get two minutes on this.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, you're right.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Race remains a significant challenge in our country.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Unfortunately, race still determines too much, often determines where people live, determines what kind of education in their public schools they can get, and, yes, it determines how they're treated in the criminal justice system.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We've just seen those two tragic examples in both Tulsa and Charlotte.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And we've got to do several things at the same time.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We have to restore trust between communities and the police.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We have to work to make sure that our police are using the best training, the best techniques, that they're well prepared to use force only when necessary.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Everyone should be respected by the law, and everyone should respect the law.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Right now, that's not the case in a lot of our neighborhoods.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So I have, ever since the first day of my campaign, called for criminal justice reform.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I've laid out a platform that I think would begin to remedy some of the problems we have in the criminal justice system.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But we also have to recognize, in addition to the challenges that we face with policing, there are so many good, brave police officers who equally want reform.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So we have to bring communities together in order to begin working on that as a mutual goal.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And we've got to get guns out of the hands of people who should not have them.

speaker: CLINTON
text: The gun epidemic is the leading cause of death of young African- American men, more than the next nine causes put together.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So we have to do two things, as I said.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We have to restore trust.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We have to work with the police.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We have to make sure they respect the communities and the communities respect them.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And we have to tackle the plague of gun violence, which is a big contributor to a lot of the problems that we're seeing today.

speaker: HOLT
text: All right, Mr. Trump, you have two minutes.

speaker: HOLT
text: How do you heal the divide?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, first of all, Secretary Clinton doesn't want to use a couple of words, and that's law and order.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we need law and order.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If we don't have it, we're not going to have a country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And when I look at what's going on in Charlotte, a city I love, a city where I have investments, when I look at what's going on throughout various parts of our country, whether it's -- I mean, I can just keep naming them all day long -- we need law and order in our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I just got today the, as you know, the endorsement of the Fraternal Order of Police, we just -- just came in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have endorsements from, I think, almost every police group, very -- I mean, a large percentage of them in the United States.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have a situation where we have our inner cities, African- Americans, Hispanics are living in he'll because it's so dangerous.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You walk down the street, you get shot.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In Chicago, they've had thousands of shootings, thousands since January 1st.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thousands of shootings.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I'm saying, where is this?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Is this a war-torn country?

speaker: TRUMP
text: What are we doing?

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we have to stop the violence.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to bring back law and order.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In a place like Chicago, where thousands of people have been killed, thousands over the last number of years, in fact, almost 4,000 have been killed since Barack Obama became president, over -- almost 4,000 people in Chicago have been killed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to bring back law and order.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, whether or not in a place like Chicago you do stop and frisk, which worked very well, Mayor Giuliani is here, worked very well in New York.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It brought the crime rate way down.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you take the gun away from criminals that shouldn't be having it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have gangs roaming the street.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And in many cases, they're illegally here, illegal immigrants.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they have guns.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they shoot people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we have to be very strong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we have to be very vigilant.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to be -- we have to know what we're doing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Right now, our police, in many cases, are afraid to do anything.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to protect our inner cities, because African-American communities are being decimated by crime, decimated.

speaker: HOLT
text: Your two -- your two minutes expired, but I do want to follow up.

speaker: HOLT
text: Stop-and-frisk was ruled unconstitutional in New York, because it largely singled out black and Hispanic young men.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, you're wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It went before a judge, who was a very against-police judge.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It was taken away from her.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And our mayor, our new mayor, refused to go forward with the case.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They would have won an appeal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If you look at it, throughout the country, there are many places where it's allowed.

speaker: HOLT
text: The argument is that it's a form of racial profiling.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, the argument is that we have to take the guns away from these people that have them and they are bad people that shouldn't have them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are felons.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are people that are bad people that shouldn't be -- when you have 3,000 shootings in Chicago from January 1st, when you have 4,000 people killed in Chicago by guns, from the beginning of the presidency of Barack Obama, his hometown, you have to have stop-and-frisk.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You need more police.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You need a better community, you know, relation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You don't have good community relations in Chicago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's terrible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have property there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's terrible what's going on in Chicago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But when you look -- and Chicago's not the only -- you go to Ferguson, you go to so many different places.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You need better relationships.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I agree with Secretary Clinton on this.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You need better relationships between the communities and the police, because in some cases, it's not good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you look at Dallas, where the relationships were really studied, the relationships were really a beautiful thing, and then five police officers were killed one night very violently.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So there's some bad things going on.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Some really bad things.

speaker: HOLT
text: Secretary Clinton...

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we need -- Lester, we need law and order.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we need law and order in the inner cities, because the people that are most affected by what's happening are African-American and Hispanic people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it's very unfair to them what our politicians are allowing to happen.

speaker: HOLT
text: Secretary Clinton?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, I've heard -- I've heard Donald say this at his rallies, and it's really unfortunate that he paints such a dire negative picture of black communities in our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ugh.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, the vibrancy of the black church, the black businesses that employ so many people, the opportunities that so many families are working to provide for their kids.

speaker: CLINTON
text: There's a lot that we should be proud of and we should be supporting and lifting up.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But we do always have to make sure we keep people safe.

speaker: CLINTON
text: There are the right ways of doing it, and then there are ways that are ineffective.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Stop-and-frisk was found to be unconstitutional and, in part, because it was ineffective.

speaker: CLINTON
text: It did not do what it needed to do.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Now, I believe in community policing.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And, in fact, violent crime is one-half of what it was in 1991.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Property crime is down 40 percent.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We just don't want to see it creep back up.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We've had 25 years of very good cooperation.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But there were some problems, some unintended consequences.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Too many young African-American and Latino men ended up in jail for nonviolent offenses.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And it's just a fact that if you're a young African-American man and you do the same thing as a young white man, you are more likely to be arrested, charged, convicted, and incarcerated.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So we've got to address the systemic racism in our criminal justice system.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We cannot just say law and order.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We have to say -- we have to come forward with a plan that is going to divert people from the criminal justice system, deal with mandatory minimum sentences, which have put too many people away for too long for doing too little.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We need to have more second chance programs.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I'm glad that we're ending private prisons in the federal system; I want to see them ended in the state system.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You shouldn't have a profit motivation to fill prison cells with young Americans.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So there are some positive ways we can work on this.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I believe strongly that commonsense gun safety measures would assist us.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Right now -- and this is something Donald has supported, along with the gun lobby -- right now, we've got too many military- style weapons on the streets.

speaker: CLINTON
text: In a lot of places, our police are outgunned.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We need comprehensive background checks, and we need to keep guns out of the hands of those who will do harm.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And we finally need to pass a prohibition on anyone who's on the terrorist watch list from being able to buy a gun in our country.

speaker: CLINTON
text: If you're too dangerous to fly, you are too dangerous to buy a gun.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So there are things we can do, and we ought to do it in a bipartisan way.

speaker: HOLT
text: Secretary Clinton, last week, you said we've got to do everything possible to improve policing, to go right at implicit bias.

speaker: HOLT
text: Do you believe that police are implicitly biased against black people?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Lester, I think implicit bias is a problem for everyone, not just police.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I think, unfortunately, too many of us in our great country jump to conclusions about each other.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And therefore, I think we need all of us to be asking hard questions about, you know, why am I feeling this way?

speaker: CLINTON
text: But when it comes to policing, since it can have literally fatal consequences, I have said, in my first budget, we would put money into that budget to help us deal with implicit bias by retraining a lot of our police officers.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I've met with a group of very distinguished, experienced police chiefs a few weeks ago.

speaker: CLINTON
text: They admit it's an issue.

speaker: CLINTON
text: They've got a lot of concerns.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Mental health is one of the biggest concerns, because now police are having to handle a lot of really difficult mental health problems on the street.

speaker: CLINTON
text: They want support, they want more training, they want more assistance.

speaker: CLINTON
