text: But she wanted to look good for the election.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So they're going in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But who's going to get Mosul, really?

speaker: TRUMP
text: We'll take Mosul eventually.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But the way -- if you look at what's happening, much tougher than they thought.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Much, much tougher.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Much more dangerous.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Going to be more deaths that they thought.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But the leaders that we wanted to get are all gone because they're smart.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They say, what do we need this for?

speaker: TRUMP
text: So Mosul is going to be a wonderful thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And Iran should write us a letter of thank you, just like the really stupid -- the stupidest deal of all time, a deal that's going to give Iran absolutely nuclear weapons.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Iran should write us yet another letter saying thank you very much, because Iran, as I said many years ago, Iran is taking over Iraq, something they've wanted to do forever, but we've made it so easy for them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we're now going to take Mosul.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And do you know who's going to be the beneficiary?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Iran.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Oh, yeah, they're making -- I mean, they are outsmarting -- look, you're not there, you might be involved in that decision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you were there when you took everybody out of Mosul and out of Iraq.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You shouldn't have been in Iraq, but you did vote for it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You shouldn't have been in Iraq, but once you were in Iraq, you should have never left the way.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Sir, your two minutes are up.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The point is, the big winner is going to be Iran.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, you know, once again, Donald is implying that he didn't support the invasion of Iraq.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I said it was a mistake.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I've said that years ago.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He has consistently denied what is...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wrong.

speaker: CLINTON
text: a very clear fact that...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wrong.

speaker: CLINTON
text: before the invasion, he supported it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And, you know, I just want everybody to go Google it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Google "Donald Trump Iraq."

speaker: CLINTON
text: And you will see the dozens of sources which verify that he was for the invasion of Iraq.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Wrong.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And you can actually hear the audio of him saying that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Now, why does that matter?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, it matters because he has not told the truth about that position.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I guess he believes it makes him look better now to contrast with me because I did vote for it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But what's really important here is to understand all the interplay.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Mosul is a Sunni city.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Mosul is on the border of Syria.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And, yes, we do need to go after Baghdadi, and -- just like we went after bin Laden, while you were doing "Celebrity Apprentice," and we brought him to justice.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We need to go after the leadership.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But we need to get rid of them, get rid of their fighters.

speaker: CLINTON
text: There are an estimated several thousand fighters in Mosul.

speaker: CLINTON
text: They've been digging underground.

speaker: CLINTON
text: They've been prepared to defend.

speaker: CLINTON
text: It's going to be tough fighting.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But I think we can take back Mosul, and then we can move on into Syria and take back Raqqa.

speaker: CLINTON
text: This is what we have to do.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I'm just amazed that he seems to think that the Iraqi government and our allies and everybody else launched the attack on Mosul to help me in this election, but that's how Donald thinks.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, he always is looking for some conspiracy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Chris, we don't gain anything.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He has all the conspiracy theories...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Iran is taking over Iraq.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, it's...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Iran is taking over Iraq.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don't gain anything.

speaker: CLINTON
text: This conspiracy theory, which he's been spewing out for quite some time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If they did it by surprise...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: WALLACE
text: Wait, wait, wait, Secretary Clinton, it's an open discussion.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He says...

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (CROSSTALK)

speaker: TRUMP
text: We could have gained if they did it by surprise.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary, please let Mr. Trump speak.

speaker: CLINTON
text: unfit, and he proves it every time he talks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, you are the one that's unfit.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know, WikiLeaks just actually came out -- John Podesta said some horrible things about you, and, boy, was he right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He said some beauties.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you know, Bernie Sanders, he said you have bad judgment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if you think that going into Mosul after we let the world know we're going in, and all of the people that we really wanted -- the leaders -- they're all gone.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If you think that was good, then you do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, John Podesta said you have terrible instincts.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Bernie Sanders said you have bad judgment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I agree with both.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, you should ask Bernie Sanders who he's supporting for president.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And he has said...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Which is a big mistake.

speaker: CLINTON
text: as he has campaigned for me around the country, you are the most dangerous person to run for president in the modern history of America.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I think he's right.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Let's turn to Aleppo.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, in the last debate, you were both asked about the situation in the Syrian city of Aleppo.

speaker: WALLACE
text: And I want to follow up on that, because you said several things in that debate which were not true, sir.

speaker: WALLACE
text: You said that Aleppo has basically fallen.

speaker: WALLACE
text: In fact, there -- in fact, there are...

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's a catastrophe.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean...

speaker: WALLACE
text: It's a catastrophe, but there...

speaker: TRUMP
text: it's a mess.

speaker: WALLACE
text: There are a quarter of...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Have you seen it?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Have you seen it?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Sir...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Have you seen what's happening to Aleppo?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Sir, if I may finish my question...

speaker: TRUMP
text: OK, so it hasn't fallen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Take a look at it.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Well, there are a quarter of a million people still living there and being slaughtered.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That's right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they are being slaughtered...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Yes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: because of bad decisions.

speaker: WALLACE
text: If I may just finish here, and you also said that -- that Syria and Russia are busy fighting ISIS.

speaker: WALLACE
text: In fact, they have been the ones who've been bombing and shelling eastern Aleppo, and they just announced a humanitarian pause, in effect, admitting that they have been bombing and shelling Aleppo.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Would you like to clear that up, sir?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, Aleppo is a disaster.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's a humanitarian nightmare.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it has fallen from the -- from any standpoint.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, what do you need, a signed document?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Take a look at Aleppo.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It is so sad when you see what's happened.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And a lot of this is because of Hillary Clinton, because what's happened is, by fighting Assad, who turned out to be a lot tougher than she thought, and now she's going to say, oh, he loves Assad, she's -- he's just much tougher and much smarter than her and Obama.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And everyone thought he was gone two years ago, three years ago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He -- he aligned with Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He now also aligned with Iran, who we made very powerful.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We gave them $150 billion back.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We give them $1.7 billion in cash.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, cash.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Bundles of cash as big as this stage.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We gave them $1.7 billion.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now they have -- he has aligned with Russia and with Iran.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They don't want ISIS, but they have other things, because we're backing -- we're backing rebels.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don't know who the rebels are.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're giving them lots of money, lots of everything.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don't know who the rebels are.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And when and if -- and it's not going to happen, because you have Russia and you have Iran now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But if they ever did overthrow Assad, you might end up with -- as bad as Assad is, and he's a bad guy, but you may very well end up with worse than Assad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If she did nothing, we'd be in much better shape.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And this is what's caused the great migration, where she's taking in tens of thousands of Syrian refugees, who probably in many cases -- not probably, who are definitely...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Let me...

speaker: TRUMP
text: in many cases, ISIS-aligned, and we now have them in our country, and wait until you see -- this is going to be the great Trojan horse.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And wait until you see what happens in the coming years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Lots of luck, Hillary.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thanks a lot for doing a great job.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, you have talked about -- and in the last debate and again today -- that you would impose a no-fly zone to try to protect the people of Aleppo and to stop the killing there.

speaker: WALLACE
text: President Obama has refused to do that because he fears it's going to draw us closer or deeper into the conflict.

speaker: WALLACE
text: And General Joseph Dunford, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, says you impose a no-fly zone, chances are you're going to get into a war -- his words -- with Syria and Russia.

speaker: WALLACE
text: So the question I have is, if you impose a no-fly zone -- first of all, how do you respond to their concerns?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secondly, if you impose a no-fly zone and a Russian plane violates that, does President Clinton shoot that plane down?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, Chris, first of all, I think a no-fly zone could save lives and could hasten the end of the conflict.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I'm well aware of the really legitimate concerns that you have expressed from both the president and the general.

speaker: CLINTON
text: This would not be done just on the first day.

speaker: CLINTON
text: This would take a lot of negotiation.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And it would also take making it clear to the Russians and the Syrians that our purpose here was to provide safe zones on the ground.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We've had millions of people leave Syria and those millions of people inside Syria who have been dislocated.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So I think we could strike a deal and make it very clear to the Russians and the Syrians that this was something that we believe was in the best interests of the people on the ground in Syria, it would help us with our fight against ISIS.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But I want to respond to what Donald said about refugees.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He's made these claims repeatedly.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I am not going to let anyone into this country who is not vetted, who we do not have confidence in.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But I am not going to slam the door on women and children.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That picture of that little 4-year-old boy in Aleppo, with the blood coming down his face while he sat in an ambulance, is haunting.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And so we are going to do very careful, thorough vetting.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That does not solve our internal challenges with ISIS and our need to stop radicalization, to work with American Muslim communities who are on the front lines to identify and prevent attacks.

speaker: CLINTON
text: In fact, the killer of the dozens of people at the nightclub in Orlando, the Pulse nightclub, was born in Queens, the same place Donald was born.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So let's be clear about what the threat is and how we are best going to be able to meet it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And, yes, some of that threat emanates from over in Syria and Iraq, and we've got to keep fighting, and I will defeat ISIS, and some of it is we have to up our game and be much smarter here at home.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Folks, I want to get into our final segment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I just have to...

speaker: WALLACE
text: Real quick.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's so ridiculous what she -- she will defeat ISIS.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We should have never let ISIS happen in the first place.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And right now, they're in 32 countries.

speaker: WALLACE
text: OK.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We should have -- wait one second.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They had a cease-fire three weeks ago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A cease-fire, the United States, Russia, and Syria.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And during the cease-fire, Russia took over vast swatches of land, and then they said we don't want the cease-fire anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are so outplayed on missiles, on cease-fires.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They are outplayed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, she wasn't there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I assume she had nothing to do with it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But our country is so outplayed by Putin and Assad, and by the way -- and by Iran.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody can believe how stupid our leadership is.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, Secretary Clinton -- no, we need to move on to our final segment, and that is the national debt, which has not been discussed until tonight.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Our national debt, as a share of the economy, our GDP, is now 77 percent.

speaker: WALLACE
text: That's the highest since just after World War II.

speaker: WALLACE
text: But the nonpartisan Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget says, Secretary Clinton, under your plan, debt would rise to 86 percent of GDP over the next 10 years.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, under your plan, they say it would rise to 105 percent of GDP over the next 10 years.

speaker: WALLACE
text: The question is, why are both of you ignoring this problem?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump, you go first.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, I say they're wrong, because I'm going to create tremendous jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we're bringing GDP from, really, 1 percent, which is what it is now, and if she got in, it will be less than zero.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we're bringing it from 1 percent up to 4 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I actually think we can go higher than 4 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think you can go to 5 percent or 6 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if we do, you don't have to bother asking your question, because we have a tremendous machine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will have created a tremendous economic machine once again.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To do that, we're taking back jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're not going to let our companies be raided by other countries where we lose all our jobs, we don't make our product anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's very sad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I'm going to create a -- the kind of a country that we were from the standpoint of industry.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We used to be there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We've given it up.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We've become very, very sloppy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We've had people that are political hacks making the biggest deals in the world, bigger than companies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You take these big companies, these trade deals are far bigger than these companies, and yet we don't use our great leaders, many of whom back me and many of whom back Hillary, I must say.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we don't use those people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Those are the people -- these are the greatest negotiators in the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have the greatest businesspeople in the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to use them to negotiate our trade deals.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We use political hacks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We use people that get the position because they gave -- they made a campaign contribution and they're dealing with China and people that are very much smarter than they are.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we have to use our great people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But that being said, we will create an economic machine the likes of which we haven't seen in many decades.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And people, Chris, will again go back to work and they'll make a lot of money.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we'll have companies that will grow and expand and start from new.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, first, when I hear Donald talk like that and know that his slogan is "Make America Great Again," I wonder when he thought America was great.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And before he rushes and says, "You know, before you and President Obama were there," I think it's important to recognize that he has been criticizing our government for decades.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, back in 1987, he took out a $100,000 ad in the New York Times, during the time when President Reagan was president, and basically said exactly what he just said now, that we were the laughingstock of the world.

speaker: CLINTON
text: He was criticizing President Reagan.

speaker: CLINTON
text: This is the way Donald thinks about himself, puts himself into, you know, the middle and says, "You know, I alone can fix it," as he said on the convention stage.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But if you look at the debt, which is the issue you asked about, Chris, I pay for everything I'm proposing.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I do not add a penny to the national debt.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I take that very seriously, because I do think it's one of the issues we've got to come to grips with.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So when I talk about how we're going to pay for education, how we're going to invest in infrastructure, how we're going to get the cost of prescription drugs down, and a lot of the other issues that people talk to me about all the time, I've made it very clear we are going where the money is.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We are going to ask the wealthy and corporations to pay their fair share.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And there is no evidence whatsoever that that will slow down or diminish our growth.

speaker: CLINTON
text: In fact, I think just the opposite.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We'll have what economists call middle-out growth.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We've got to get back to rebuilding the middle class, the families of America.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's where growth will come from.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's why I want to invest in you.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I want to invest in your family.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I think that's the smartest way to grow the economy, to make the economy fairer.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And we just have a big disagreement about this.

speaker: CLINTON
text: It may be because of our experiences.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, he started off with his dad as a millionaire...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yeah, yeah, we've heard -- we've heard this before, Hillary.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I started off with -- my dad was a small-business man.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We've heard this before.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I think it -- you know, it's a difference that affects how we see the world and what we want to do with the economy.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you, Hillary.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Could I just respond?

speaker: WALLACE
text: Well, no, sir, because we're running out of time...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because I did disagree with Ronald Reagan very strongly on trade.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I disagreed with him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We should have been much tougher on trade even then.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I've been waiting for years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody does it right.

speaker: WALLACE
text: OK.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And frankly, now we're going to do it right.

speaker: WALLACE
text: All right.

speaker: WALLACE
text: The one last area I want to get into with you in this debate is the fact that the biggest driver of our debt is entitlements, which is 60 percent of all federal spending.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Now, the Committee for federal -- a Responsible Federal Budget has looked at both of your plans and they say neither of you has a serious plan that is going to solve the fact that Medicare's going to run out of money in the 2020s, Social Security is going to run out of money in the 2030s, and at that time, recipients are going to take huge cuts in their benefits.

speaker: WALLACE
text: So, in effect, the final question I want to ask you in this regard is -- and let me start with you, Mr. Trump, would President Trump make a deal to save Medicare and Social Security that included both tax increases and benefit cuts, in effect, a grand bargain on entitlements?

speaker: TRUMP
text: I'm cutting taxes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're going to grow the economy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's going to grow at a record rate of growth.

speaker: WALLACE
text: That's not going to help in the entitlements.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, it's going to totally help you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And one thing we have to do: Repeal and replace the disaster known as Obamacare.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's destroying our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's destroying our businesses, our small business and our big businesses.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to repeal and replace Obamacare.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You take a look at the kind of numbers that that will cost us in the year '17, it is a disaster.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If we don't repeal and replace -- now, it's probably going to die of its own weight.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But Obamacare has to go.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's -- the premiums are going up 60 percent, 70 percent, 80 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Next year they're going to go up over 100 percent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I'm really glad that the premiums have started -- at least the people see what's happening, because she wants to keep Obamacare and she wants to make it even worse, and it can't get any worse.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Bad health care at the most expensive price.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to repeal and replace Obamacare.

speaker: WALLACE
text: And, Secretary Clinton, same question, because at this point, Social Security and Medicare are going to run out, the trust funds are going to run out of money.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Will you as president entertain -- will you consider a grand bargain, a deal that includes both tax increases and benefit cuts to try to save both programs?

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, Chris, I am on record as saying that we need to put more money into the Social Security Trust Fund.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's part of my commitment to raise taxes on the wealthy.

speaker: CLINTON
text: My Social Security payroll contribution will go up, as will Donald's, assuming he can't figure out how to get out of it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But what we want to do is to replenish the Social Security Trust Fund...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Such a nasty woman.

speaker: CLINTON
text: by making sure that we have sufficient resources, and that will come from either raising the cap and/or finding other ways to get more money into it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I will not cut benefits.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I want to enhance benefits for low-income workers and for women who have been disadvantaged by the current Social Security system.

speaker: CLINTON
text: But what Donald is proposing with these massive tax cuts will result in a $20 trillion additional national debt.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That will have dire consequences for Social Security and Medicare.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I'll say something about the Affordable Care Act, which he wants to repeal.

speaker: CLINTON
text: The Affordable Care Act extended the solvency of the Medicare Trust Fund.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So if repeals it, our Medicare problem gets worse.

speaker: CLINTON
text: What we need to do is go after...

speaker: TRUMP
text: Your husband disagrees with you.

speaker: CLINTON
text: the long-term health care drivers.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We've got to get costs down, increase value, emphasize wellness.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I have a plan for doing that.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I think that we will be able to get entitlement spending under control by with more resources and harder decisions.

speaker: WALLACE
text: This is -- this is the final time, probably to both of your delight, that you're going to be on a stage together in this campaign.

speaker: WALLACE
text: I would like to end it on a positive note.

speaker: WALLACE
text: You had not agreed to closing statements, but it seems to me in a funny way that might make it more interesting because you haven't prepared closing statements.

speaker: WALLACE
text: So I'd like you each to take -- and we're going to put a clock up, a minute, as the final question in the final debate, to tell the American people why they should elect you to be the next president.

speaker: WALLACE
text: This is another new mini-segment.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, it's your turn to go first.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, I would like to say to everyone watching tonight that I'm reaching out to all Americans -- Democrats, Republicans, and independents -- because we need everybody to help make our country what it should be, to grow the economy, to make it fairer, to make it work for everyone.

speaker: CLINTON
text: We need your talents, your skills, your commitments, your energy, your ambition.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, I've been privileged to see the presidency up close.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I know the awesome responsibility of protecting our country and the incredible opportunity of working to try to make life better for all of you.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I have made the cause of children and families really my life's work.

speaker: CLINTON
text: That's what my mission will be in the presidency.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I will stand up for families against powerful interests, against corporations.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I will do everything that I can to make sure that you have good jobs, with rising incomes, that your kids have good educations from preschool through college.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I hope you will give me a chance to serve as your president.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, thank you.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Mr. Trump?

speaker: TRUMP
text: She's raising the money from the people she wants to control.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Doesn't work that way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But when I started this campaign, I started it very strongly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It's called "Make America Great Again."

speaker: TRUMP
text: We're going to make America great.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have a depleted military.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It has to be helped, has to be fixed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have the greatest people on Earth in our military.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We don't take care of our veterans.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We take care of illegal immigrants, people that come into the country illegally, better than we take care of our vets.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That can't happen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our policemen and women are disrespected.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We need law and order, but we need justice, too.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Our inner cities are a disaster.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You get shot walking to the store.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They have no education.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They have no jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will do more for African-Americans and Latinos than she can ever do in 10 lifetimes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All she's done is talk to the African-Americans and to the Latinos, but they get the vote, and then they come back, they say, we'll see you in four years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are going to make America strong again, and we are going to make America great again, and it has to start now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We cannot take four more years of Barack Obama, and that's what you get when you get her.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Thank you both.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton -- hold on just a moment, folks.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Secretary Clinton, Mr. Trump, I want to thank you both for participating in all three of these debates.

speaker: WALLACE
text: That brings to an end this year's debates sponsored by the Commission on Presidential Debates.

speaker: WALLACE
text: We want to thank the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, and its students for having us.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Now the decision is up to you.

speaker: WALLACE
text: While millions have already voted, Election Day, November 8th, is just 20 days away.

speaker: WALLACE
text: One thing everyone here can agree on: We hope you will go vote.

speaker: WALLACE
text: It is one of the honors and obligations of living in this great country.

speaker: WALLACE
text: Thank you, and good night.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I just wanted to begin by mentioning that the nominee for Secretary of the Department of Labor will be Mr.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Alex Acosta.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He has a law degree from Harvard Law School, was a great student.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Former clerk for Justice Samuel Alito.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he has had a tremendous career.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hes a member, and has been a member, of the National Labor Relations Board, and has been through Senate confirmation three times, confirmed  did very, very well.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And so Alex, Ive wished him the best.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We just spoke.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And hes going to be  I think hell be a tremendous Secretary of Labor.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And also, as you probably heard just a little while ago, Mick Mulvaney, former congressman, has just been approved  weeks late, I have to say that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weeks, weeks late.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Office of Management and Budget.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he will be, I think, a fantastic addition.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Paul Singer has just left.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As you know, Paul was very much involved with the anti-Trump, or, as they say, "Never Trump." And Paul just left and hes given us his total support.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And its all about unification.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Were unifying the party, and hopefully were going to be able to unify the country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its very important to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ive been talking about that for a long time, but its very, very important to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I want to thank Paul Singer for being here and for coming up to the office.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He was a very strong opponent, and now hes a very strong ally.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I appreciate that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think Ill say a few words, and then well take some questions.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I had this time  weve been negotiating a lot of different transactions to save money on contracts that were terrible, including airplane contracts that were out of control and late and terrible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Just absolutely catastrophic in terms of what was happening.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And weve done some really good work.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Were very proud of that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And then right after that, you prepare yourselves and well do some questions  unless you have no questions.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thats always a possibility.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Im here today to update the American people on the incredible progress that has been made in the last four weeks since my inauguration.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have made incredible progress.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I dont think theres ever been a President elected who, in this short period of time, has done what weve done.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A new Rasmussen poll, in fact  because the people get it; much of the media doesnt get it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They actually get it, but they dont write it  lets put it that way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But a new Rasmussen poll just came out just a very short while ago, and it has our approval rating at 55 percent and going up.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The stock market has hit record numbers, as you know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And there has been a tremendous surge of optimism in the business world, which is  to me means something much different than it used to.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It used to mean, oh, thats good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now it means thats good for jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Very different.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Plants and factories are already starting to move back into the United States and big league  Ford, General Motors, so many of them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Im making this presentation directly to the American people with the media present, which is an honor to have you this morning, because many of our nations reporters and folks will not tell you the truth and will not treat the wonderful people of our country with the respect that they deserve.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I hope going forward we can be a little bit different, and maybe get along a little bit better, if thats possible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Maybe its not, and thats okay too.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Unfortunately, much of the media in Washington, D.C., along with New York, Los Angeles, in particular, speaks not for the people but for the special interests and for those profiting off a very, very obviously broken system.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The press has become so dishonest that if we dont talk about it, we are doing a tremendous disservice to the American people  tremendous disservice.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to talk about it to find out whats going on, because the press honestly is out of control.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The level of dishonesty is out of control.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I ran for President to represent the citizens of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am here to change the broken system so it serves their families and their communities well.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I am talking, and really talking, on this very entrenched power structure, and what were doing is were talking about the power structure, were talking about its entrenchment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As a result, the media is going through what they have to go through to oftentimes distort  not all the time  and some of the media is fantastic, I have to say; theyre honest and fantastic.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But much of it is not  the distortion.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And well talk about it, and youll be able to ask me questions about it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But were not going to let it happen, because Im here again to take my message straight to the people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As you know, our administration inherited many problems across government and across the economy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To be honest, I inherited a mess  its a mess  at home and abroad.

speaker: TRUMP
text: A mess.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Jobs are pouring out of the country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You see whats going on with all of the companies leaving our country, going to Mexico and other places  low-pay, low-wages.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mass instability overseas, no matter where you look.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The Middle East, a disaster.

speaker: TRUMP
text: North Korea  well take care of it, folks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Were going to take care of it all.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I just want to let you know I inherited a mess.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Beginning on day one, our administration went to work to tackle these challenges.

speaker: TRUMP
text: On foreign affairs, weve already begun enormously productive talks with many foreign leaders  much of it youve covered  to move forward toward stability, security, and peace in the most troubled regions of the world, which there are many.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve had great conversations with the United Kingdom  and meetings  Israel, Mexico, Japan, China, and Canada.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Really, really productive conversations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I would say far more productive than you would understand.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve even developed a new council with Canada to promote womens business leaders and entrepreneurs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its very important to me, very important to my daughter Ivanka.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have directed our defense community, headed by our great general, now Secretary Mattis  hes over there now, working very hard  to submit a plan for the defeat of ISIS, a group that celebrates the murder and torture of innocent people in large sections of the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It used to be a small group, and now its in large sections of the world.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Theyve spread like cancer.

speaker: TRUMP
text: ISIS has spread like cancer.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Another mess I inherited.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we have imposed new sanctions on the nation of Iran, whos totally taken advantage of our previous administration.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And theyre the worlds top sponsor of terrorism.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And were not going to stop until that problem is properly solved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And its not properly solved now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its one of the worst agreements Ive ever seen drawn by anybody.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ive ordered plans to begin for the massive rebuilding of the United States military.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ive had great support from the Senate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ive had great support from Congress generally.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve pursued this rebuilding in the hopes that we will never have to use this military.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I will tell you that is my  I would be so happy if we never had to use it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But our country will never have had a military like the military were about to build and rebuild.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have the greatest people on Earth in our military, but they dont have the right equipment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And their equipment is old.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I used it, I talked about it at every stop.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Depleted  its depleted.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It wont be depleted for long.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I think one of the reasons Im standing here instead of other people is that, frankly, I talked about we have to have a strong military.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have to have strong law enforcement also.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we do not go abroad in the search of war.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We really are searching for peace, but its peace through strength.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At home, we have begun the monumental task of returning the government back to the people on a scale not seen in many, many years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In each of these actions, Im keeping my promises to the American people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are campaign promises.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Some people are so surprised that were having strong borders.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, thats what Ive been talking about for a year and a half  strong borders.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Theyre so surprised  "oh, youre having strong borders."

speaker: TRUMP
text: One promise after another after years of politicians lying to you to get elected.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, thats what Ive been talking about to the press and to everybody else.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They lie to the American people in order to get elected.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Some of the things Im doing probably arent popular, but theyre necessary for security and for other reasons.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And then coming to Washington and pursuing their own interests, which is more important to many politicians.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Im here following through on what I pledged to do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thats all Im doing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I put it out before the American people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Got 306 Electoral College votes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I wasnt supposed to get 222.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They said theres no way to get 222; 230 is impossible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Two hundred and seventy, which you need, that was laughable.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We got 306 because people came out and voted like theyve never seen before.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So thats the way it goes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I guess it was the biggest Electoral College win since Ronald Reagan.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In other words, the media is trying to attack our administration because they know we are following through on pledges that we made, and theyre not happy about it for whatever reason.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But a lot of people are happy about it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, Ill be in Melbourne, Florida, five oclock on Saturday, and I heard  just heard that the crowds are massive that want to be there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I turn on the TV, open the newspapers, and I see stories of chaos.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Chaos!

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yet, it is the exact opposite.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This administration is running like a fine-tuned machine, despite the fact that I cant get my Cabinet approved, and theyre outstanding people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Like Senator Dan Coates whose there  one of the most respected men of the Senate  he cant get approved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: How do you not approve him?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hes been a colleague, highly respected  brilliant guy, great guy, everybody knows it  but waiting for approval.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we have a wonderful group of people thats working very hard, thats being very much misrepresented about, and we cant let that happen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So if the Democrats, who have  all you have to do is look at where they are right now  the only thing they can do is delay, because theyve screwed things up royally, believe me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Let me list to you some of the things that weve done in just a short period of time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I just got here.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I got here with no Cabinet.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Again, each of these actions is a promise I made to the American people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So well go over just some of them, and we have a lot happening next week and in the weeks coming.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve withdrawn from the job-killing disaster known as Trans-Pacific Partnership.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Were going to make trade deals, but were going to have one-on-one deals  bilateral.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Were going to have one-on-one deals.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve directed the elimination of regulations that undermine manufacturing, and called for expedited approval of the permits needed for America and American infrastructure, and that means plants, equipment, roads, bridges, factories.

speaker: TRUMP
text: People take 10, 15, 20 years to get disapproved for a factory.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They go in for a permit  its many, many years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And then at the end of the process  they spend tens of millions of dollars on nonsense  and at the end of the process, they get rejected.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, they may be rejected with me, but its going to be a quick rejection.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its not going to take years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But mostly, its going to be an acceptance.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We want plants built, and we want factories built, and we want the jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We dont want the jobs going to other countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve imposed a hiring freeze on nonessential federal workers.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve imposed a temporary moratorium on new federal regulations.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve issued a game-changing new rule that says for each one new regulation, two old regulations must be eliminated.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Makes sense.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody has ever seen regulations like we have.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If you go to other countries and you look at industries they have, and you say, let me see your regulations, and theyre a fraction, just a tiny fraction of what we have.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I want regulations because I want safety, I want all environmental situations to be taken properly care of.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its very important to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But you dont need four or five or six regulations to take care of the same thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve stood up for the men and women of law enforcement, directing federal agencies to ensure they are protected from crimes of violence.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve directed the creation of a task force for reducing violent crime in America, including the horrendous situation  take a look at Chicago and others  taking place right now in our inner cities.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Horrible.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve ordered the Department of Homeland Security and Justice to coordinate on a plan to destroy criminal cartels coming into the United States with drugs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Were becoming a drug-infested nation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Drugs are becoming cheaper than candy bars, and were not going to let it happen any longer.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve undertaken the most substantial border security measures in a generation to keep our nation and our tax dollars safe, and are now in the process of beginning to build a promised wall on the southern border.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Met with General, now Secretary, Kelly yesterday and were starting that process.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the wall is going to be a great wall, and its going to be a wall negotiated by me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The price is going to come down, just like it has on everything else Ive negotiated for the government.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And were going to have a wall that works.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Were not going to have a wall like they have now, which is either nonexistent or a joke.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve ordered a crackdown on sanctuary cities that refuse to comply with federal law and that harbor criminal aliens, and weve ordered an end to the policy of catch and release on the border.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No more release, no matter who you are  release.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve begun a nationwide effort to remove criminal aliens, gang members, drug dealers, and others who pose a threat to public safety.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are saving American lives every single day.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The court system has not made it easy for us.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And weve even created a new office in Homeland Security dedicated to the forgotten American victims of illegal immigrant violence, of which there are many.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve taken decisive action to keep radical Islamic terrorists out of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Though parts of our necessary and constitutional actions were blocked by a judges, in my opinion, incorrect and unsafe ruling, our administration is working night and day to keep you safe  including reporters safe  and is vigorously defending this lawful order.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I will not back down from defending our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I got elected on defense of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I keep my campaign promises.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And our citizens will be very happy when they see the result.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They already are.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I can tell you that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Extreme vetting will be put in place, and it already is in place in many places.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, we had to go quicker than we thought because of the bad decision we received from a circuit that has been overturned at a record number.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ive heard 80 percent  I find that hard to believe; thats just a number I heard  that theyre overturned 80 percent of the time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think that circuit is in chaos and that circuit is, frankly, in turmoil.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we are appealing that and we are going further.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Were issuing a new executive action next week that will comprehensively protect our country, so well be going along the one path and hopefully winning that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At the same time, we will be issuing a new and very comprehensive order to protect our people, and that will be done some time next week, toward the beginning or middle at the latest part.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve also taken steps to begin construction of the Keystone Pipeline and Dakota Access Pipelines  thousands and thousands of jobs  and put new "Buy American" measures in place to require American steel for American pipelines.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In other words, they build a pipeline in this country and we use the powers of government to make that pipeline happen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We want them to use American steel.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And theyre willing to do that, but nobody ever asked before I came along.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Even this order was drawn and they didnt say that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And Im reading the order, Im saying, why arent we using American steel?

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they said, thats a good idea.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We put it in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: To drain the swamp of corruption in Washington, D.C.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ive started by imposing a five-year lobbying ban on White House officials and a lifetime ban on lobbying for a foreign government.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve begun preparing to repeal and replace Obamacare.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Obamacare is a disaster, folks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its a disaster.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You can say, oh, Obamacare  I mean, they fill up our alleys with people that you wonder how they get there, but theyre not the Republican people that our representatives are representing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So weve begun preparing to repeal and replace Obamacare and are deep in the midst of negotiations on a very historic tax reform to bring our jobs back.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Were bringing our jobs back to this country big league.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its already happening, but big league.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ive also worked to install a Cabinet over the delays and obstruction of Senate Democrats.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Youve seen what theyve done over the last long number of years.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That will be one of the great Cabinets ever assembled in American history.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You look at Rex Tillerson  hes out there negotiating right now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: General Mattis I mentioned before, General Kelly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have great, great people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mick is with us now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We have great people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Among their responsibilities will be ending the bleeding of jobs from our country and negotiating fair trade deals for our citizens.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, look, fair trade  not free  fair.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If a country is taking advantage of us, were not going to let that happen anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Every country takes advantage of us, almost.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I may be able to find a couple that dont.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But for the most part, that would be a very tough job for me to do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Jobs have already started to surge.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Since my election, Ford announced it will abandon its plans to build a new factory in Mexico and will instead invest $700 million in Michigan, creating many, many jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Fiat-Chrysler announced it will invest $1 billion in Ohio and Michigan, creating 2,000 new American jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They were with me a week ago.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know  you were here.

speaker: TRUMP
text: General Motors, likewise, committed to invest billions of dollars in its American manufacturing operation, keeping many jobs here that were going to leave.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And if I didnt get elected, believe me, they would have left.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And these jobs and these things that Im announcing would never have come here.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Intel just announced that it will move ahead with a new plant in Arizona that probably was never going to move ahead with.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that will result in at least 10,000 American jobs.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Walmart announced it will create 10,000 jobs in the United States just this year because of our various plans and initiatives.

speaker: TRUMP
text: There will be many, many more.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Many more.

speaker: TRUMP
text: These are a few that were naming.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Other countries have been taking advantage of us for decades  decades and decades and decades, folks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And were not going to let that happen anymore.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Not going to let it happen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And one more thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have kept my promise to the American people by nominating a justice of the United States Supreme Court, Judge Neil Gorsuch, who is from my list of 20, and who will be a true defender of our laws and our Constitution  highly respected, should get the votes from the Democrats  you may not see that, but hell get there one way or the other.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But he should get there the old-fashioned way, and he should get those votes.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This last month has represented an unprecedented degree of action on behalf of the great citizens of our country.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Again, I say it  there has never been a presidency thats done so much in such a short period of time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And we havent even started the big work that starts early next week.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Some very big things are going to be announced next week.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So were just getting started.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We will be giving a speech, as I said, in Melbourne, Florida, at 5:00 p.m.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I hope to see you there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And with that, Id just say, God bless America, and lets take some questions.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mara.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mara, go ahead.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You were cut off pretty violently at our last news conference.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Did you fire Mike Flynn?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mike Flynn is a fine person, and I asked for his resignation.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He respectfully gave it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He is a man who  there was a certain amount of information given to Vice President Pence, who is with us today.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I was not happy with the way that information was given.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He didnt have to do that, because what he did wasnt wrong, what he did in terms of the information he saw.

speaker: TRUMP
text: What was wrong was the way that other people, including yourselves in this room, were given that information, because that was classified information that was given illegally.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thats the real problem.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you can talk all you want about Russia, which was all a fake news, fabricated deal to try and make up for the loss of the Democrats, and the press plays right into it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: In fact, I saw a couple of the people that were supposedly involved with all of this  they know nothing about it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They werent in Russia, they never made a phone call to Russia, they never received a phone call.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its all fake news.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its all fake news.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The nice thing is I see it starting to turn, where people are now looking at the illegal, Mara  and I think its very important  the illegal giving out classified information.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And let me just tell you, it was given out, like, so much.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ill give you an example.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I called, as you know, Mexico.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It was a very confidential, classified call, but I called Mexico.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And in calling Mexico, I figured, oh, well, thats  I spoke to the President of Mexico, had a good call.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All of a sudden its out for the world to see.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its supposed to be secret.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its supposed to be either confidential or classified in that case.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Same thing with Australia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All of a sudden people are finding out exactly what took place.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The same thing happened with respect to General Flynn.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Everybody saw this, and Im saying  the first thing I thought of when I heard about it is, how does the press get this information thats classified?

speaker: TRUMP
text: How do they do it?

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know why?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because its an illegal process, and the press should be ashamed of themselves.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But, more importantly, the people that gave out the information to the press should be ashamed of themselves.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Really ashamed.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Why did you keep your Vice President in the dark for almost two weeks?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because when I looked at the information, I said, I dont think he did anything wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: If anything, he did something right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He was coming into office, he looked at the information.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He said, huh, thats fine, thats what theyre supposed to do.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Theyre supposed to be  and he didnt just call Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He called and spoke to, both ways  I think there were 30-some-odd countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hes doing the job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know, he was just doing his job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The thing is he didnt tell our Vice President properly, and then he said he didnt remember.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So either way, it wasnt very satisfactory to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I have somebody that I think will be outstanding for the position, and that also helps, I think, in the making of my decision.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But he didnt tell the Vice President of the United States the facts, and then he didnt remember.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And that just wasnt acceptable to me.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes.

speaker: QUESTION
text: President Trump, since you brought up Russia, Im looking for some clarification here.

speaker: QUESTION
text: During the campaign, did anyone from your team communicate with members of the Russian government or Russian intelligence?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And if so, what was the nature of those conversations?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, the failing New York Times wrote a big, long front-page story yesterday.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it was very much discredited, as you know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: It was  its a joke.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the people mentioned in the story  I notice they were on television today saying they never even spoke to Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They werent even a part, really  I mean, they were such a minor part  I hadnt spoken to them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think the one person, I dont think Ive ever spoken to him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I dont think Ive ever met him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he actually said he was a very low-level member of, I think, a committee for a short period of time.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I dont think I ever met him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, its possible that I walked into a room and he was sitting there, but I dont think I ever met him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I didnt talk to him, ever.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he thought it was a joke.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The other person said he never spoke to Russia, never received a call.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Look at his phone records, et cetera, et cetera.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the other person, people knew that hed represented various countries, but I dont think he represented Russia  but knew that he represented various countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thats what he does.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, people know that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thats Mr. Manafort, whos, by the way  whos, by the way, a respected man.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Hes a respected man.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I think he represented the Ukraine, or Ukraine government, or somebody.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But everybody  people knew that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Everybody knew that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So these people  and he said that he has absolutely nothing to do and never has with Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he said that very forcefully.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I saw his statement.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He said it very forcefully.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Most of the papers dont print it because thats not good for their stories.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So the three people that they talked about all totally deny it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I can tell you, speaking for myself, I own nothing in Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have no loans in Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I dont have any deals in Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: President Putin called me up very nicely to congratulate me on the win of the election.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He then called me up extremely nicely to congratulate me on the inauguration, which was terrific.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But so did many other leaders  almost all other leaders from almost all other countries.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So thats the extent.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Russia is fake news.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Russia  this is fake news put out by the media.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The real news is the fact that people, probably from the Obama administration because theyre there  because we have our new people going in place right now.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As you know, Mike Pompeo is now taking control of the CIA.

speaker: TRUMP
text: James Comey at FBI.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Dan Coats is waiting to be approved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, he is a senator, and a highly respected one.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And hes still waiting to be approved.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But our new people are going in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And just while youre at, because you mentioned this, Wall Street Journal did a story today that was almost as disgraceful as the failing New Timess story yesterday.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it talked about  you saw it, front page.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So, Director of National Intelligence just put out  acting  a statement: "Any suggestion that the United States intelligence community"  this was just given to us  "is withholding information and not providing the best possible intelligence to the President and his national security team is not true."

speaker: TRUMP
text: So they took this front-page story out of The Wall Street Journal  top  and they just wrote the story is not true.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And Ill tell you something, Ill be honest  because I sort of enjoy this back and forth, and I guess I have all my life, but Ive never seen more dishonest media than, frankly, the political media.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I thought the financial media was much better, much more honest.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I will say that I never get phone calls from the media.

speaker: TRUMP
text: How do they write a story like that in The Wall Street Journal without asking me?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Or how do they write a story in The New York Times, put it on front page?

speaker: TRUMP
text: That was like that story they wrote about the women and me  front page.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Big massive story.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it was nasty.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And then they called.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They said, "We never said that. We like Mr. Trump."

speaker: TRUMP
text: They called up my office  we like Mr. Trump; we never said that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it was totally  they totally misrepresented those very wonderful women, I have to tell you  totally misrepresented.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I said, give us a retraction.

speaker: TRUMP
text: They never gave us a retraction.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And, frankly, I then went on to other things.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President

speaker: TRUMP
text: You okay?

speaker: QUESTION
text: I am.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Just wanted to get untangled.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Very simply, you said today that you had the biggest electoral margins since Ronald Reagan with 304 or 306 electoral votes.

speaker: QUESTION
text: In fact, President Obama got 365 in 2008.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, Im talking about Republican.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes.

speaker: QUESTION
text: President Obama, 332.

speaker: QUESTION
text: George H.W.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Bush, 426 when he won as President.

speaker: QUESTION
text: So why should Americans trust

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, no, I was told  I was given that information.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I dont know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I was just given.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We had a very, very big margin.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I guess my question is, why should Americans trust you when you have accused the information they receive of being fake when youre providing information thats fake?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, I dont know.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I was given that information.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I was given  actually, Ive seen that information around.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But it was a very substantial victory.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Do you agree with that?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Youre the President.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay, thank you.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thats a good answer.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President, thank you so much.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Can you tell us in determining that Lieutenant General Flynn  there was no wrongdoing in your mind, what evidence was weighed?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Did you have the transcripts of these telephone intercepts with Russian officials, particularly Ambassador Kislyak, who he was communicating with?

speaker: QUESTION
text: What evidence did you weigh to determine there was no wrong doing?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And further than that, sir, youve said on a couple of occasions this morning that you were going to aggressively pursue the sources of these leaks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We are.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Can we ask what youre doing to do?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And also, weve heard about a review of the intelligence community headed by Stephen Feinberg.

speaker: QUESTION
text: What can you tell us about that?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, first of all, about that, we now have Dan Coats, hopefully soon Mike Pompeo and James Comey, and theyre in position.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I hope that well be able to straighten that out without using anybody else.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The gentleman you mentioned is a very talented man, very successful man.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And he has offered his services, and its something we may take advantage of.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I dont think well need that at all because of the fact that I think that were going to be able to straighten it out very easily on its own.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As far as the general is concerned, when I first heard about it, I said, huh, that doesnt sound wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: My counsel came  Don McGahn, White House Counsel  and he told me, and I asked him, and he can speak very well for himself.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He said he doesnt think anything is wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He really didnt think  it was really what happened after that, but he didnt think anything was done wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I didnt either, because I waited a period of time and I started to think about it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I said, well, I dont see  to me, he was doing the job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The information was provided by  who I dont know  Sally Yates  and I was a little surprised because I said, doesnt sound like he did anything wrong there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But he did something wrong with respect to the Vice President, and I thought that was not acceptable.

speaker: TRUMP
text: As far as the actual making the call  in fact, Ive watched various programs and Ive read various articles where he was just doing his job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: That was very normal.

speaker: TRUMP
text: At first, everybody got excited because they thought he did something wrong.

speaker: TRUMP
text: After they thought about it, it turned out he was just doing his job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So  and I do  and, by the way, with all of that being said, I do think hes a fine man.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, Jon.

speaker: QUESTION
text: On the leaks, sir

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead, finish off, then Ill get you, Jon.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Sorry, what will you do on the leaks?

speaker: QUESTION
text: You have said twice today

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, were looking at it very, very seriously.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ive gone to all of the folks in charge of the various agencies, and were  Ive actually called the Justice Department to look into the leaks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Those are criminal leaks.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Theyre put out by people either in agencies.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think youll see it stopping because now we have our people in.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know, again, we dont have our people in because we cant get them approved by the Senate.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We just had Jeff Sessions approved in Justice, as an example.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So we are looking into that very seriously.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its a criminal act.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know what I say  when I was called out on Mexico, I was shocked.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because all this equipment, all this incredible phone equipment.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When I was called out on Mexico, I was  honestly, I was really, really surprised.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I said, you know, it doesnt make sense, that wont happen.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But that wasnt that important to call, it was fine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I could show it to the world and he could show it to the world  the President who is a very fine man, by the way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Same thing with Australia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I said, thats terrible that it was leaked but it wasnt that important.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But then I said, what happens when Im dealing with the problem of North Korea?

speaker: TRUMP
text: What happens when Im dealing with the problems in the Middle East?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Are you folks going to be reporting all of that very, very confidential information  very important, very  I mean, at the highest level, are you going to be reporting about that too?

speaker: TRUMP
text: So I dont want classified information getting out to the public.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And in a way, that was almost a test.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So Im dealing with Mexico.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Im dealing with Argentina.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We were dealing on this case with Mike Flynn.

speaker: TRUMP
text: All this information gets put into the Washington Post and gets put into the New York Times.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And Im saying, whats going to happen when Im dealing on the Middle East?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Whats going to happen when Im dealing with really, really important subjects like North Korea?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Weve got to stop it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thats why its a criminal penalty.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, Jon.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Thank you, Mr. President.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I just want to get you to clarify just a very important point.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Can you say definitively that nobody on your campaign had any contacts with the Russians during the campaign?

speaker: QUESTION
text: And, on the leaks, is it fake news or are these real leaks?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, the leaks are real.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Youre the one that wrote about them and reported them.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, the leaks are real.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You know what they said  you saw it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And the leaks are absolutely real.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The news is fake because so much of the news is fake.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So one thing that I felt it was very important to do  and I hope we can correct it, because there is nobody I have more respect for  well, maybe a little bit  than reporters, than good reporters.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its very important to me, and especially in this position.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its very important.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I dont mind bad stories.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I can handle a bad story better than anybody as long as its true.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And over a course of time, Ill make mistakes and youll write badly and Im okay with that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But Im not okay when it is fake.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, I watch CNN  its so much anger and hatred and just the hatred.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I dont watch it anymore because its very good  hes saying no.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its okay, Jim.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Its okay, Jim.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Youll have your chance.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I watch others too.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Youre not the only one, so dont feel badly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I think it should be straight.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think it should be  I think it would be, frankly, more interesting.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I know how good everybodys ratings are right now, but I think that actually would be  I think that it would actually be better.

speaker: TRUMP
text: People  I mean, you have a lower approval rate than Congress.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think thats right.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I dont know, Peter, is that one right?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Because you know, I think they have lower  I heard, lower than Congress.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But honestly, the public would appreciate it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Id appreciate it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Again, I dont mind bad stories when its true.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But we have an administration where the Democrats are making it very difficult.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I think were setting a record, or close to a record in the time of approval of a Cabinet.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I mean, the numbers are crazy.

speaker: TRUMP
text: When Im looking  some of them had them approved immediately.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Im going forever, and I still have a lot of people that were waiting for.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And thats all theyre doing, is delaying.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you look at Schumer and the mess that hes got over there, and they have nothing going.

speaker: TRUMP
text: The only thing they can do is delay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And you know, I think theyd be better served by approving and making sure that theyre happy and everybody is good.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And sometimes, I mean  I know President Obama lost three or four, and you lose them on the way.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And thats okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Thats fine.

speaker: TRUMP
text: But I think they would be much better served, Jon, if they just went through the process quickly.

speaker: TRUMP
text: This is pure delay tactics.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And they say it, and everybody understands it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yeah, go ahead, Jim.

speaker: QUESTION
text: The first part of my question on contacts.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Do you definitively say that nobody

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, I had nothing to do with it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have nothing to do with Russia.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I told you, I have no deals there.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I have no anything.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Now, when WikiLeaks, which I had nothing to do with, comes out and happens to give  theyre not giving classified information.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Theyre giving stuff  what was said at an office about Hillary cheating on the debates  which, by the way, nobody mentions.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Nobody mentions that Hillary received the questions to the debates.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Can you imagine  seriously, can you imagine if I received the questions?

speaker: TRUMP
text: It would be the electric chair, okay?

speaker: TRUMP
text: He should be put in the electric chair. You would even call for the reinstitution of the death penalty, okay?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Maybe not you, Jon.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes, well do you next, Jim.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Ill do you next.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Yes?

speaker: QUESTION
text: Thank you, Mr. President.

speaker: QUESTION
text: I just want to clarify one other thing.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Sure.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Did you direct Mike Flynn to discuss the sanctions with the Russian ambassador?

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I didnt.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I didnt.

speaker: QUESTION
text: (Inaudible.)

speaker: QUESTION
text: (Off mic.)

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I didnt.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Did you fire him because (inaudible)

speaker: TRUMP
text: Excuse me  no, I fired him because of what he said to Mike Pence, very simple.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Mike was doing his job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: He was calling countries and his counterparts.

speaker: TRUMP
text: So it certainly would have been okay with me if he did it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I would have directed him to do it if I thought he wasnt doing it.

speaker: TRUMP
text: I didnt direct him but I would have directed him because thats his job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And it came out that way  and, in all fairness, I watched Dr.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Charles Krauthammer the other night say he was doing his job.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And I agreed with him.

speaker: TRUMP
text: And since then Ive watched many other people say that.

speaker: TRUMP
text: No, I didnt direct him, but I would have directed him if he didnt do it, okay?

speaker: TRUMP
text: Jim.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Mr. President, thank you very much.

speaker: QUESTION
text: And just for the record, we dont hate you, I dont hate you.

speaker: QUESTION
text: If you could pass that along.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, ask Jeff Zucker how he got his job, okay?

speaker: QUESTION
text: If I may follow up on some of the questions that have taken place so far, sir.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Well, not too many.

speaker: TRUMP
text: We do have other people.

speaker: TRUMP
text: You do have other people, and your ratings arent as good as some of the other people that are waiting.

speaker: QUESTION
text: Theyre pretty good right now, actually.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Okay.

speaker: TRUMP
text: Go ahead, Jim.

speaker: QUESTION
